title: Are they any major metal bands that have a lead singer who sings bass? - Quora

response.answer_text: Two bands come to mind when I think of lead singer who also plays bass Motörhead and Slayer Motörhead has some pretty good songs out there, which don’t tend to have very harsh vocals, and isn’t super fast paced. Lemmy’s voice is just unmistakably recognizable. He also plays bass. May he Rest In Peace. Slayer’s Tom Araya can definitely scream his vocal cords raw, and play bass at the same time. Slayer has many head banging songs, if you’re into the more heavier and faster type of metal. Either way, you can’t go wrong with either band, since they are both good in their respective genres of metal. Hope this helps!

For metal bands bands with vocalists who play bass, here’s the ones I can name: Motörhead, KISS, Primus, Slayer, Type O Negative, Sodom, Destruction, Sacred Reich, Nile, Terrorizer, Hatriot, and Swashbuckle. Overkill and Blind Guardian have lead singers who can play bass but have so far chosen not to

Motörhead How can anyone forget Lemmy? That guy plays bass, sings, and writes all the music. Primus They aren't metal metal, but Les Claypool is one of the best bass players in all of rock. Type O Negative (and Carnivore) Peter Steele is the man. He sings well and he plays well.

“Primus” might not be characterised as metal but a lot of metal fans like them. “Carcass” are relatively major in a lot of circles. Less so are “Sacred Reich”, “Gorefest” and “Skinlab” which pop into mind but were considered rather major in their time(s).
Besides literally playing bass guitar, or comically, bass cello, Peter Steele, from the bands Carnivore and Type O Negative, had a notedly deep low voice.
